title: Nevada Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records, memos, correspondences (such as emails, faxes, text messages, phone messages) relating to the organizational structure, funding sources, operational philosophy, personnel composition, and legal justification for the Nevada Internet Crimes Against Children Task Force, in relation to the operation announced in a August 15, 2025 press release by the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, entitled "Eight Child Sex Predators Arrested During Undercover Operation," and in which the following agencies are listed as participants: Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department, Federal Bureau of Investigation, North Las Vegas Police Department, Henderson Police Department, Homeland Security Investigations, and the Nevada Attorney General’s office

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Tracey

title: First Amendment Trainings for Federal Law-Enforcement Officers (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any materials or programming (including handouts, slideshows, videos, textbooks, or other media) used in connection with providing training or guidance to law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the following subjects: (a) The First Amendment; (b) protests or demonstrations; (c) freedom of speech or expression; (d) filming police officers. This request is limited to materials used in trainings since January 1, 2020.

2. Any policy concerning whether trainings on the topics mentioned in (1) are mandatory, or regulating the frequency of such trainings.

3. A copy of any document sufficient to show the most recent training conducted for law-enforcement officers in your agency with respect to any of the subjects in (1). For example, this could be a receipt or contract for an outside vendor or speaker, or it could be a dated sign-in sheet from the training.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: BOE Contact Form Submissions

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: BOE Contact Form Submissions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all submissions made through the Board of Education website contact form during the period from July 1, 2024 through the date of this request.

I understand that some submissions may contain information exempt from disclosure (e.g., student education records protected by under state/federal law, or personally identifying information). I respectfully request that any such information be redacted as necessary, rather than withholding the entire record.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

- The current contract or retainer agreement, and any amendments or extensions currently in effect, between the Town of Thomaston and its Town Attorney (including any law firm currently engaged to serve in that capacity); or, if no current agreement is in effect, the most recent version of such an agreement.

- The current agreement, and any amendments or extensions currently in effect, between the Town of Thomaston and its independent auditor for annual financial statement audits; or, if no current agreement is in effect, the most recent version of such an agreement.

title: Senior Prank Investigation

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Senior Prank Investigation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the investigation of the events of June 3, 2025, referred to as the “senior prank investigation report”, including: 

- The final report regarding the investigation.
- All relevant information gathered during the investigation, as referenced at the Board of Education meeting on August 18, 2025.
- A copy of the email written to Chairperson Fainer regarding the investigation, and any subsequent responses from board member(s) and/or the Chairperson, as referenced at the Board of Education meeting on August 18, 2025.
- Copies of any invoices submitted by attorneys or law firms related to this investigation.

This request specifically seeks the above records, but does not include materials that are exempt from disclosure under the attorney–client privilege as provided in Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(b)(10). I ask that, where applicable, any portions deemed privileged be redacted rather than withholding entire records.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Bellford

title: Minnesota communications PFAS

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Minnesota communications PFAS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any electronic communications between Katrina Kessler, Peter Tester, Frank Kohlasch, Kirk Koudelka, and/or Dana Vanderbosch and employees and/or representatives for the following organizations:
The Semiconductor Industry Association (email addresses with the domain @semiconductors.org)
American Chemistry Council (email addresses with the domain @americanchemistry.com)
Polar Semiconductor (email addresses with the domain @polarsemi.com)
SEMI (email addresses with the domain @semi.org)

- Any minutes, presentations, associated documents, or other notes from meetings of the informal rulemaking "check-in" working group comprised of manufacturing and industry representatives, as detailed on this MPCA website: https://www.pca.state.mn.us/get-engaged/pfas-in-products Materials should be for meetings held between July 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed.

In order to help to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am a journalist for WIRED magazine. Disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in my commercial interest.

In the interest of time, I request that you provide documents as they become available rather than waiting for the complete set.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Molly Taft

communications.subject: RE: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Minnesota communications PFAS-INFORMATION REQUEST FORM NEEDED
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

The MPCA has a new information request form. Please use the link below. Also, share with others that use our records requests system as well. The MPCA doesn't not label our records according to property, Tax, or parcel ID#'s. An exact address or  MPCA preferred ID# will be needed to search our records.  The information request form has an area Information requested, where you can Describe the information that you need (be as specific as you can).  Once your request form is received it will be processed and assigned to a file manager for completion.


https://www.pca.state.mn.us/about-mpca/information-request-form

This link has replaced the PDF form. Thank you and enjoy your day.

title: Onboarding/offboarding details for Nate Cavanaugh and Jeremy Lewin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request any records related to the onboarding and possible offboarding of the following two individuals who have worked for the GSA this year, as well as detailing to other agencies:

- Nate Cavanaugh was onboarded on or about February 3 of this year and announced he had resigned from government on August 6th. According to news reports, he had been detailed to multiple agencies in the service of DOGE's activities. I would like to request any SF-50/hiring docs from GSA, including if his position was converted to a different role (or moved from a volunteer to a pay position).
- Jeremy Lewin was hired on or around January 20th. Since then, he has been detailed to several agencies, including USAID and CFPB and has been appointed to positions within both USAID and the Department of State. Nevertheless,  a news report on July 11th indicated that Lewin was still listed in the GSA directory as an employee. Is he still technically an employee of the agency. Is he still detailed to other agencies? He continues to be employed in the federal government.

I would like to request the SF-50s and other onboarding / offboarding details for these two individuals. If possible, I would also like to request any relevant detailing arrangements for these individuals to other agencies by the GSA (or possibly even back to the GSA from other agencies if Jeremy Lewin's employment has ended at GSA but he has been detailed back from USAID or State).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Harris

title: Public Records Request Luffman v Collinsville Unnit School District #10

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Public Records Request Luffman v Collinsville Unnit School District #10
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act Request

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140, I am requesting the following records:
	1.	All internal communications (including emails, letters, memoranda, and attachments) sent to or from the following individuals:
	•	Attorney Dana Bond
	•	Attorney Barney Mundorf
	•	Superintendent Mark Skertich
	•	Assistant Superintendent Brad Hyre
	•	FOIA Officer Susan Frechman
	2.	The scope of this request is limited to records created by or shared among these individuals, not correspondence originated by me (Jeffrey Luffman). Please exclude any emails, letters, or attachments in which I am the sender or direct author.
	3.	I am specifically seeking records where my name (“Jeff Luffman,” “Jeffrey Luffman,” “Mr. Luffman”) or any of the following case numbers appear in the subject line, body of the message, or attachments:
	•	State cases (Illinois):
	•	22-DC-325 (family court)
	•	25-OP-611 (order of protection)
	•	25-CM-534 (criminal matter)
	•	25-0473 (Illinois Fifth District Appellate Court appeal)
	•	Illinois Supreme Court cases:
	•	132033 (Rule 384 supervisory petition)
	•	132103 (mandamus petition)
	•	Federal cases:
	•	25-cv-842-SPM (U.S. District Court, Southern District of Illinois, §1983 civil rights complaint)
	•	25-2049 (U.S. Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit appeal)
	•	U.S. Supreme Court:
	•	Verified Petition for Writ of Certiorari filed August 11, 2025 (awaiting docketing).
	4.	Date Range: January 1, 2024 – Present.

This request is intended to capture how district officials, their counsel, and associated attorneys are discussing me and my litigation internally and with one another, not simply reproducing my own correspondence to them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeffrey Luffman

title: University Anti-Semitism Response Policies (Arizona State University)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern at {agency name}: 

This is a request for the following records pursuant to the {law name}. I hereby request the following records: 

1. Any written or recorded {agency name} policies (including, without limitation, university guidance, orientation programs, handbooks, manuals, standards, speech codes, and/or internal memoranda) issued and/or updated following President Trump’s January 29, 2025 Executive Order 14188* that include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination 
b) harassment
c) hostile 
d) campus safety
e) Anti-Semitism
f) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) 
g) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act 

*The executive order can be found here:
https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/03/2025-02230/additional-measures-to-combat-anti-semitism

2. Any written or recorded internal communications (including, without limitation, staff meeting minutes, emails, internal instant messaging records, and/or internal memoranda) that reference the above-mentioned executive order and include any of the following terms (and/or any variations of these terms):
a) discrimination 
b) harassment
c) hostile 
d) campus safety
e) investigation
f) Anti-Semitism
g) International Holocaust Remembrance Alliance (IHRA) 
h) Anti-Semitism Awareness Act 

Fee waiver request: {waiver}. This request is made on behalf of the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, a nonprofit and nonpartisan organization that aims to defend and sustain the individual rights of all Americans to free speech and free thought. We request a waiver of any fees or costs associated with this request.

This request concerns a matter of public interest. It is important that we access these public records in order to effectively advocate for students and staff at the {agency name}. The records are not sought for a commercial or personal interest, but rather for the purpose of providing the public with information concerning civil liberties in higher education. 

If you elect to charge a fee, please provide a cost estimate for each category of documents requested. Please also provide me with a W-9 form.

Request for expedited processing: The records pertain to a matter of public importance and current debate. Providing expedited production of the records will facilitate the public understanding of these matters before they are fully resolved. Any undue delay in production will undermine the purpose of the public records laws, which serve to allow public input and oversight of government affairs. In any event, {short name} law requires that a request be acted upon in {days} days.

Additionally, if any specific categories of requested records will require a significantly longer production time than those in other categories, please provide records for each category on a piecemeal basis as they become available. 

Request for Privilege Log: If any otherwise responsive documents are withheld on the basis that they are privileged or fall within a statutory exemption, please provide a privilege log setting forth (1) the subject matter of the document; (2) the person(s) who sent and received the document; (3) the date the document was created or sent; and (4) the basis on which the document is withheld.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

If I can be of assistance in interpreting or narrowing this request, please don’t hesitate to ask.

Best,

{name}

Charlotte Arneson
Program Counsel, Campus Rights Advocacy 
Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE)
700 Pennsylvania Avenue, Southeast, Suite 340
Washington, D.C. 20003
Ph: 215-717-3473 ext. 263
thefire.org
